snippet.title: Happy 100th, Wrigley Field! A few memories
snippet.description: Wrigley Field, the home of the Chicago Cubs, marks the 100th anniversary of its first game on Wednesday with a matchup against Arizona. The ballpark that opened as Weeghman Park on April 23, 1914, has hosted millions of fans and been the scene of some of baseball's most indelible moments. Some stars who graced its friendly confines offer their memories:

snippet.title: 'Lovers at the Chameleon Club, Paris 1932,' by Francine Prose
snippet.description: Francine Prose assembles a spectacular cast of characters to describe Paris at war.

snippet.title: Summer movie preview: Hollywood bets big again
snippet.description: Like jumbo jets on the runway, Hollywood's summer movies are lined up, ready for takeoff. Will they hit any turbulence?

snippet.title: 1 year after bombs, Boston Marathon a celebration
snippet.description: Unfinished business. Defiance. Hope, strength and resilience. They used different words but the meaning was the same for thousands of people who were stopped by twin bombings at last year's Boston Marathon and came back this year to finish what they started.

snippet.title: Mexico City pays tribute to Gabriel Garcia Marquez
snippet.description: The city that the writer called home honors its late resident.

snippet.title: In show of defiance, 32,000 run Boston Marathon
snippet.description: Some ran to honor the dead and wounded. Others were out to prove something to the world about their sport, the city or their country. And some wanted to prove something to themselves.

snippet.title: Remembering Gabriel García Márquez, and Macondo
snippet.description: His imagined worlds had a lasting impact on many real lives.

snippet.title: Wonkbook: 8 million is not the only Obamacare number that counts
snippet.description: Here's why Obamacare is not just one number.

snippet.title: Sucked into the vortex of lost rings and their miraculous rediscovery
snippet.description: David Copperfield has nothing on this amazing magic trick, 30 years in the making.

snippet.title: Garcia Marquez: More than just a magic realist
snippet.description: Magic realism was only one of his gifts. From crime stories and village folklore to romance and satire, Gabriel Garcia Marquez brought poetry to virtually every popular genre.
